name: Mwnt
description: Tiny perfect cove with whitewashed church above. Dolphins frequently seen. Steep steps to beach. National Trust - arrive early in summer.

name: Llangrannog
description: Charming village beach squeezed between cliffs. Coast path access to quieter coves north and south. Traditional seaside atmosphere.

name: Aberystwyth North Beach
description: Classic Victorian seaside resort beach. Promenade, pier, and full town facilities immediately adjacent. Popular for sunsets and strolling.

name: Borth Beach
description: Three miles of sand and shingle. Popular for surfing and walking. Ancient submerged forest visible at very low tides.

name: Ynyslas Beach
description: Stunning sand dunes at the mouth of the Dovey Estuary. National Nature Reserve. Great for kitesurfing and views across to Aberdyfi.

name: Blue Pool (Ceibwr)
description: Natural tidal pool carved into cliffs. Dramatic setting. Access requires care - steep path. Best 2 hours either side of low tide.

name: Clarach Bay
description: [Research Needed] Popular bay north of Aberystwyth with holiday parks.

name: Penbryn Beach
description: [Research Needed] National Trust beach known for dark skies and golden sand.

name: Tresaith Beach
description: [Research Needed] Sandy beach famous for the waterfall cascading onto the beach.

name: Aberporth Beach
description: [Research Needed] Two sandy beaches popular with families. Sheltered waters.

name: New Quay Harbour Beach
description: [Research Needed] Sheltered harbour beach famous for dolphin spotting boat trips.

name: Cwmtydu Beach
description: [Research Needed] Quiet cove, historically a smugglers' haunt. Good for seal spotting.
